description: Customize the Asana experience, leverage your data with the Asana API, and join a community of developers building with Asana.

blocks.name: getSingleAttachment
blocks.description: Returns the full record for a single attachment.

args.name: attachmentId
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the attachment.

blocks.name: getAttachmentsOnTask
blocks.description: Returns the compact records for all attachments on the task.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the task.

blocks.name: uploadAttachmentToTask
blocks.description: Returns the compact records for all attachments on the task.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the task.

blocks.name: getProjectCustomFieldsSettings
blocks.description: Returns a list of all of the custom fields settings on a project, in compact form. Note that, as in all queries to collections which return compact representation, opt_fields and opt_expand can be used to include more data than is returned in the compact representation. See the getting started guide on input/output options for more information.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project for which to list custom field settings.

blocks.name: getCustomField
blocks.description: Returns the complete definition of a custom field’s metadata.

args.name: fieldId
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the custom field.

blocks.name: getAllCustomFields
blocks.description: Returns a list of the compact representation of all of the custom fields in a workspace.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace or organization to find custom field definitions in.

blocks.name: getEvents
blocks.description: Returns the full record for all events that have occurred since the sync token was created.

args.name: resource
args.info: A resource ID to subscribe to. The resource can be a task or project.

args.name: sync
args.info: A sync token received from the last request, or none on first sync. Events will be returned from the point in time that the sync token was generated.

blocks.name: createProject
blocks.description: Creates a new project in a workspace or team.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace or organization to create the project in.

args.name: team
args.info: If creating in an organization, the specific team to create the project in.

blocks.name: getSingleProject
blocks.description: Returns the complete project record for a single project.

blocks.name: updateProject
blocks.description: A specific, existing project can be updated. Only the fields provided in the data block will be updated; any unspecified fields will remain unchanged.

blocks.name: deleteProject
blocks.description: A specific, existing project can be deleted by making a DELETE request on the URL for that project.

blocks.name: queryProjects
blocks.description: Returns the compact project records for some filtered set of projects. Use one or more of the parameters provided to filter the projects returned.

args.name: archived
args.info: Only return projects whose archived field takes on the value of this parameter.

blocks.name: getProjectTasks
blocks.description: Returns the compact task records for all tasks within the given project, ordered by their priority within the project. Tasks can exist in more than one project at a time.

args.name: project
args.info: The project in which to search for tasks.

blocks.name: createProjectCustomFieldSetting
blocks.description: Create a new custom field setting on the project.

args.name: project
args.info: The project to associate the custom field with.

args.name: customField
args.info: The id of the custom field to associate with this project.

args.name: isImportant
args.info: Whether this field should be considered important to this project.

args.name: insertBefore
args.info: An id of a Custom Field Settings on this project, before which the new Custom Field Settings will be added. insert_before and insert_after parameters cannot both be specified.

args.name: insertAfter
args.info: An id of a Custom Field Settings on this project, after which the new Custom Field Settings will be added. insert_before and insert_after parameters cannot both be specified.

blocks.name: createSection
blocks.description: Creates a new section in a project.

args.name: project
args.info: The project to associate the custom field with.

args.name: name
args.info: The text to be displayed as the section name. This cannot be an empty string..

blocks.name: getProjectSections
blocks.description: Returns the compact records for all sections in the specified project.

args.name: project
args.info: The project to associate the custom field with.

blocks.name: getSingleSection
blocks.description: Returns the complete record for a single section.

blocks.name: updateSection
blocks.description: When using this method, it is best to specify only those fields you wish to change, or else you may overwrite changes made by another user since you last retrieved the task.

blocks.name: deleteSection
blocks.description: Note that sections must be empty to be deleted.

blocks.name: reorderSections
blocks.description: At this point in time, moving sections is not supported in list views, only board views.

args.name: beforeSection
args.info: Insert the given section immediately before the section specified by this parameter.

args.name: afterSection
args.info: Insert the given section immediately before the section specified by this parameter.

blocks.name: getTaskStories
blocks.description: Returns the compact records for all stories on the task.

args.name: task
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the task.

blocks.name: getSingleStory
blocks.description: Returns the full record for a single story.

args.name: story
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the story.

blocks.name: addCommentToTask
blocks.description: Adds a comment to a task. The comment will be authored by the currently authenticated user, and timestamped when the server receives the request.

args.name: task
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the task.

args.name: text
args.info: The plain text of the comment to add.

blocks.name: createTag
blocks.description: Creates a new tag in a workspace or organization.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace or organization to create the tag in.

blocks.name: getSingleTag
blocks.description: Returns the complete tag record for a single tag.

blocks.name: updateTag
blocks.description: Updates the properties of a tag. Only the fields provided in the data block will be updated; any unspecified fields will remain unchanged.

blocks.name: queryTags
blocks.description: Returns the compact tag records for some filtered set of tags. Use one or more of the parameters provided to filter the tags returned.

args.name: archived
args.info: Only return tags whose archived field takes on the value of this parameter.

blocks.name: getTasksByTag
blocks.description: Returns the compact task records for all tasks with the given tag. Tasks can have more than one tag at a time.

args.name: tag
args.info: The tag to fetch tasks from.

blocks.name: createTask
blocks.description: Creating a new task.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace to create a task in.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the task. This is generally a short sentence fragment that fits on a line in the UI for maximum readability. However, it can be longer.

args.name: followers
args.info: List of users following this task.

args.name: assignee
args.info: User to which this task is assigned, or null if the task is unassigned.

args.name: notes
args.info: More detailed, free-form textual information associated with the task.

blocks.name: getTask
blocks.description: Returns the complete task record for a single task.

blocks.name: updateTask
blocks.description: Existing task can be updated.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the task. This is generally a short sentence fragment that fits on a line in the UI for maximum readability. However, it can be longer.

args.name: assignee
args.info: User to which this task is assigned, or null if the task is unassigned.

args.name: notes
args.info: More detailed, free-form textual information associated with the task.

blocks.name: deleteTask
blocks.description: Deleted tasks go into the “trash” of the user making the delete request. Tasks can be recovered from the trash within a period of 30 days; afterward they are completely removed from the system.

blocks.name: queryTasks
blocks.description: Returns the compact task records for all tasks within the given project, ordered by their priority within the project.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The project in which to search for tasks.

blocks.name: createSubtask
blocks.description: Creates a new subtask and adds it to the parent task. Returns the full record for the newly created subtask.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to add a subtask to.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the task. This is generally a short sentence fragment that fits on a line in the UI for maximum readability. However, it can be longer.

args.name: followers
args.info: List of users following this task.

args.name: assignee
args.info: User to which this task is assigned, or null if the task is unassigned.

args.name: notes
args.info: More detailed, free-form textual information associated with the task.

blocks.name: getProjectsByTask
blocks.description: Returns a compact representation of all of the projects the task is in.

args.name: task
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the task.

blocks.name: addTaskToProject
blocks.description: Adds the task to the specified project, in the optional location specified. If no location arguments are given, the task will be added to the end of the project.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to add to a project.

args.name: project
args.info: The project to add the task to.

args.name: insertAfter
args.info: A task in the project to insert the task after, or null to insert at the beginning of the list.

args.name: insertBefore
args.info: A task in the project to insert the task before, or null to insert at the end of the list.

args.name: section
args.info: A section in the project to insert the task into. The task will be inserted at the bottom of the section.

blocks.name: removeTaskFromProject
blocks.description: Removes the task from the specified project. The task will still exist in the system, but it will not be in the project anymore.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to remove from a project.

args.name: project
args.info: The project to remove the task from.

blocks.name: getTaskTags
blocks.description: Returns a compact representation of all of the tags the task has.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to get tags on.

blocks.name: addTagToTask
blocks.description: Adds a tag to a task. Returns an empty data block.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to add a tag to.

args.name: tag
args.info: The tag to add to the task.

blocks.name: removeTagFromTask
blocks.description: Removes a tag from the task. Returns an empty data block.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to remove a tag from.

args.name: tag
args.info: The tag to remove from the task.

blocks.name: addFollowersToTask
blocks.description: Adds each of the specified followers to the task, if they are not already following. Returns the complete, updated record for the affected task.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to add followers to.

args.name: followers
args.info: List of followers to add to the task.

blocks.name: removeFollowersFromTask
blocks.description: Removes each of the specified followers from the task if they are following. Returns the complete, updated record for the affected task.

args.name: task
args.info: The task to remove followers from.

args.name: followers
args.info: List of followers to add to the task.

blocks.name: getOrganizationSingleTeam
blocks.description: Returns the full record for a single team.

args.name: team
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the team.

blocks.name: getOrganizationTeams
blocks.description: Returns the full record for a single team.

args.name: organization
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization.

blocks.name: getTeamsUserAssignedTo
blocks.description: Returns the compact records for all teams to which user is assigned.

args.name: userId
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the team.

blocks.name: getTeamMembersUsers
blocks.description: Returns the compact records for all users that are members of the team.

args.name: team
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the team.

blocks.name: addUserToTeam
blocks.description: The user making this call must be a member of the team in order to add others.

args.name: team
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the team.

args.name: user
args.info: An identifier for the user. Can be one of an email address, the globally unique identifier for the user, or the keyword me to indicate the current user making the request.

blocks.name: removeUserFromTeam
blocks.description: The user to remove can be referenced by their globally unique user ID or their email address. Removes the user from the specified team. Returns an empty data record.

args.name: team
args.info: Globally unique identifier for the team.

args.name: user
args.info: An identifier for the user. Can be one of an email address, the globally unique identifier for the user, or the keyword me to indicate the current user making the request.

blocks.name: queryTypeahead
blocks.description: This method returns typeahead search results.

args.name: query
args.info: The value to look up. This is a string that will be used to search for relevant objects. If an empty string is passed in, the API will currently return an empty set.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of object to look up. You can choose from one of the following: project, user, task, and tag. Note that unlike other endpoints, the types listed here are in singular form. Using multiple types is not yet supported.

args.name: count
args.info: The number of results to return. The default is 20 if this parameter is omitted, with a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 100. If there are fewer results found than requested, all will be returned.

blocks.name: getSingleUser
blocks.description: Returns the full user record for the single user with the provided ID.

args.name: user
args.info: An identifier for the user. Can be one of an email address, the globally unique identifier for the user, or the keyword me to indicate the current user making the request.

blocks.name: getUsers
blocks.description: Returns the user records for all users in the specified workspace or organization.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace in which to get users.

blocks.name: createWebhook
blocks.description: Establishing a webhook is a two-part process. First, a simple HTTP POST similar to any other resource creation. Since you could have multiple webhooks we recommend specifying a unique local id for each target.

args.name: resource
args.info: A resource ID to subscribe to. The resource can be a task or project.

args.name: target
args.info: The URL to receive the HTTP POST.

blocks.name: getWebhooks
blocks.description: Returns the compact representation of all webhooks your app has registered for the authenticated user in the given workspace.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace to query for webhooks in.

blocks.name: getSingleWebhook
blocks.description: Returns the full record for the given webhook.

blocks.name: deleteWebhook
blocks.description: This method permanently removes a webhook. Note that it may be possible to receive a request that was already in flight after deleting the webhook, but no further requests will be issued.

blocks.name: getWorkplaces
blocks.description: Returns the full workspace record for a single workspace.

blocks.name: updateWorkplace
blocks.description: Currently the only field that can be modified for a workspace is its name.

blocks.name: typeaheadSearch
blocks.description: Retrieves objects in the workspace based on an auto-completion/typeahead search algorithm. This feature is meant to provide results quickly, so do not rely on this API to provide extremely accurate search results. The result set is limited to a single page of results with a maximum size, so you won’t be able to fetch large numbers of results.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace to fetch objects from.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of values the typeahead should return. Note that unlike in the names of endpoints, the types listed here are in singular form (e.g. task). Using multiple types is not yet supported.

args.name: query
args.info: The string that will be used to search for relevant objects. If an empty string is passed in, the API will currently return an empty result set.

args.name: count
args.info: The number of results to return. The default is 20 if this parameter is omitted, with a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 100. If there are fewer results found than requested, all will be returned.

blocks.name: addUserToWorkspace
blocks.description: The user can be referenced by their globally unique user ID or their email address. Returns the full user record for the invited user.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace or organization to invite the user to.

args.name: user
args.info: An identifier for the user. Can be one of an email address, the globally unique identifier for the user, or the keyword me to indicate the current user making the request.

blocks.name: removeUserFromWorkspace
blocks.description: The user making this call must be an admin in the workspace. Returns an empty data record.

args.name: workspace
args.info: The workspace or organization to invite the user to.

args.name: user
args.info: An identifier for the user. Can be one of an email address, the globally unique identifier for the user, or the keyword me to indicate the current user making the request.
